      • forceChangeField

        public static final void forceChangeField(java.lang.Object object,
                    java.lang.String fieldName,
                    boolean newValue)
                                   throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Force change a boolean field value
        Parameters:
        object - Object where lies the field
        fieldName - Field name
        newValue - New value
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - If field not exists
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If field isn't boolean
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If force failed

      • forceInvokeMethod

        public static final void forceInvokeMethod(java.lang.Object object,
                     java.lang.String methodName,
                     java.lang.Class<?>[] types,
                     java.lang.Object[] values)
                                    throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                           java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Force invoke a method
        Parameters:
        object - Object where lies the method
        methodName - Method name
        types - Types of arguments
        values - Parameters value
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If method not exists
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of argument not valid
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If force failed
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - If launch method failed

      • invokePublicMethod

        public static final java.lang.Object invokePublicMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                  java.lang.String methodName,
                                  java.lang.Object... parameters)
                                                 throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                        java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Invoke a public method from a class.
        It is recommends to call static method with this, for non static, prefer use invokePublicMethod(Object, String, Object...)
        If the method is non static, this method first try create an instance of the specified class with a "little" constructor, it use newInstance(Class) to do it.
        NOTE :The method must be public, this method haven't rights to invoke other methods, so if not public, not found exception was throw
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class where the method lies
        methodName - Method name to invoke
        parameters - Methods parameters
        Returns:
        method result or null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If the given method is not public, or not exists with the parameters
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When invoke failed
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - When invoke failed
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - When invoke failed

      • invokePublicMethod

        public static final java.lang.Object invokePublicMethod(java.lang.Object instance,
                                  java.lang.String methodName,
                                  java.lang.Object... parameters)
                                                 throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                        java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Invoke a public method form a class represents by its instance.
        We use this instance for invoke the method.
        NOTE :The method must be public, this method haven't rights to invoke other methods, so if not public, not found exception was throw
        Parameters:
        instance - Instance of the class where method lies
        methodName - Method name to invoke
        parameters - Methods parameters
        Returns:
        method result
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If the given method is not public, or not exists with the parameters
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When invoke failed
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - When invoke failed
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - When invoke failed

        Indicates if a class extends an other one
        Parameters:
        test - Class to test
        parent - Class to extends
        Returns:
        true if class extends an other one

      • isSubTypeOf

        public static final boolean isSubTypeOf(java.lang.Class<?> testedClass,
                  java.lang.Class<?> parentOrInterface)
        Indicates if a class extends or implements directly or not a class or a interface
        Parameters:
        testedClass - Class tested
        parentOrInterface - Class or interface to extends or implements
        Returns:
        true if the class extends or implements directly or not the class or interface

      • newInstance

        public static final java.lang.Object newInstance(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Try create an instance of a class.
        It first look for "little" public constructor, that is to say a constructor with few parameters, if it founds default constructor without parameters, it use it.
        If the constructor founds have parameters, it creates a instance of each parameters (on calling itself) an the use them for construct the instance.
        BEWARE:
        • In some case, it can falls in infinite loop
        • It is not human, so can't read documentation and may use illegal argument for create the instance
        Parameters:
        type - Class type to create
        Returns:
        Created instance

      • newInstance

        public static final java.lang.Object newInstance(java.lang.String typeName)
                                          throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Try create an instance of a class.
        It first look for "little" public constructor, that is to say a constructor with few parameters, if it founds default constructor without parameters, it use it.
        If the constructor founds have parameters, it creates a instance of each parameters (on calling itself) an the use them for construct the instance.
        BEWARE:
        • In some case, it can falls in infinite loop
        • It is not human, so can't read documentation and can use illegal argument for create the instance
        Parameters:
        typeName - Class name
        Returns:
        Instance created
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the class can't be resolve

      • newInstance

        public static final java.lang.Object newInstance(java.lang.String typeName,
                           java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
                                          throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Try create an instance of a class.
        It first look for "little" public constructor, that is to say a constructor with few parameters, if it founds default constructor without parameters, it use it.
        If the constructor founds have parameters, it creates a instance of each parameters (on calling itself) an the use them for construct the instance.
        BEWARE:
        • In some case, it can falls in infinite loop
        • It is not human, so can't read documentation and can use illegal argument for create the instance
        Parameters:
        typeName - Type name
        classLoader - Class loader to use
        Returns:
        Instance created
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the class can't be resolve

      • obtainPublicMethod

        public static final java.lang.reflect.Method obtainPublicMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                          java.lang.String methodName,
                                          java.lang.Class<?>... types)
                                                         throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        Obtain public method from a class
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class where method lies
        methodName - Method name
        types - Method parameters type
        Returns:
        The method
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If the method not public or not exists with specified types

      • obtainTypes

        public static final java.lang.Class<?>[] obtainTypes(java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Extract all types of given parameters.
        If the parameter is null, just null is return.
        If some parameters are null, the corresponding type was also null
        Parameters:
        parameters - Parameters to extract is types
        Returns:
        Extracted types.

      • typeMatch

        public static final boolean typeMatch(java.lang.Class<?> class1,
                java.lang.Class<?> class2)
        Indicates if 2 types are similar.
        null is accepted for parameters
        Parameters:
        class1 - First type
        class2 - Second type
        Returns:
        true if types are similar

      • typeMatch

        public static final boolean typeMatch(java.lang.Class<?>[] types1,
                java.lang.Class<?>[] types2)
        Indicates if 2 arrays of types are similar.
        Array says similar if they have same length and each type of arrays are one to one similar
        null are consider like zero length array
        Each array can contains null elements.
        For the compare 2 types, it use typeMatch(Class, Class)
        Parameters:
        types1 - First array
        types2 - Second array
        Returns:
        true if arrays are similar
